intro: Sideroxylon alachuense, commonly known as the Alachua ironwood, is a small evergreen tree native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and rough, fissured bark. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is adapted to well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open woodlands. Due to its hardiness and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
